title: Millie Mackintosh forced to admit she's not pregnant as Vogue Williams questions why she's not drinking Prosecco
text:

Millie Mackintosh was left squirming when her friend Vogue Williams hinted at a possible pregnancy during the first episode of reality show, Spencer , Vogue and Wedding Too on Monday night.

Viewers watched as the best friends headed to the Kate Halfpenny Bridal store in London so Vogue could try on dresses for her second wedding to husband and fellow reality star Spencer, 31.

An awkward TV moment saw Vogue, 34, raise suspicion about Millie's quest to get pregnant as she pointed out: "Millie's the only one who didn't touch the prosecco."

Millie, 30, appeared totally shocked by Vogue's revelation in the wedding shop and kept a straight face as she awkwardly replied: "I'm not pregnant."

(Image: E4)

Vogue then filled the awkward silence with laughter and admitted: "no, I know. You're not meant to be pregnant yet.

"We are saving it for together", the TV presenter told her other friends, "Millie and I are going to get pregnant together."

Vogue and Spencer returned to screens last night with a reality show that covers them raising one-year-old son Theodore.

The new show comes as the stars said 'I do' for the second time and admitted they'd 'love another baby' just eight months after giving birth.

(Image: E4)

(Image: E4)

Spencer and Vogue delighted fans with their E4 reality series Spencer, Vogue and Baby Too, which documented them welcoming first child Theodore into the world last year. This follow-up sees them organise and hold a second wedding.

Yesterday, Vogue revealed she and pal Millie have made a secret pact to get ­pregnant at the same time so they can be “mum friends”.

Vogue and Spencer are eager to give son Theodore a sibling while Millie and Made In Chelsea ’s Hugo Taylor, 33, are planning their first child after tying the knot last year.

(Image: E4)

(Image: E4)

Vogue said: “We’ve got a pact, me and Millie. It’s nice she wants to do it. I want another mum friend. I’m going to push her to go quicker.”

The TV presenter has been thinking about having more children with hubby Spencer Matthews for a while now.

The power couple met in 2017 while competing in Channel 4’s The Jump.

(Image: E4)

(Image: E4)

The ex- Dancing with the Stars celeb says: “I would definitely like two more and possibly three but it’s a lot of work so we will see how we feel after baby no.2."

She added: "I want to enjoy Theodore for a little while longer but not too much either because there is not too much space between my sister and I and we are the best of friends and I would like that for Theodore too.

"A two year gap would be perfect."

Spencer, Vogue and Wedding Two continues on Monday on C4 at 10pm.
description: The reality star was left squirming when her pal Vogue hinted at pregnancy after she refused to drink prosecco during new show filming
